data_elements.name: Crop Year

business_rules.description: Only Current Year (2016)

data_elements.definition:
A period of time (in year) within which the crop is normally grown and designated by the calendar year in which the crop is normally harvested. For crops:
  • Harvested over 2 calendar years, the crop year is the calendar year in which the majority of the crop would have been harvested.
  • Grown over more than 2 calendar years, each year in the growing period will be considered as a separate crop year designated by the calendar year in which the crop sustained a loss.
  • For which CAT coverage is available, the crop year will be as defined by such coverage.
Risk Management Agency's regulations define Crop Year as the period within which the insured crop is normally grown, regardless of whether or not it is actually grown, and designated by the calendar year in which the insured crop is normally harvested, unless otherwise specified in the Crop Provisions.

data_elements.name: Administrative State Farm Service Agency Code

business_rules.description: The value must be in pilot area
Must use active combinations of Administrative State FSA Code, Administrative County FSA Code, Farm Number, Tract Number, Field Number, and CLU Identifier per FSA Farm Records

data_elements.definition:
A state code of administering state office.

State code used within the Farm Service Agency (FSA) to identify a state within the United States, United States Possessions, freely associated areas of the United States, or a combination thereof as defined within Handbook 1-CM, Exhibit 100.

Many of the code values used by State FSA Code are similar to State ANSI/FIPS Code, which follows the American National Standards Institute (ANSI) numeric INCITS 31-2009 and Federal Information Processing Standards Publications (FIPS Pub) 6-4 standard. In some cases FSA codes are different from the ANSI/FIPS codes.

Specific values are documented in the Handbook 1-CM, Exhibit 100. A machine-readable version can be found here

data_elements.name: Administrative County Farm Service Agency Code

business_rules.description: The value must be a valid county for the applicable value in Administrative State FSA Code
Must use active combinations of Administrative State FSA Code, Administrative County FSA Code, Farm Number, Tract Number, Field Number, and CLU Identifier per FSA Farm Records

data_elements.definition:
A county code of the administering county office.

The code is used within the Farm Service Agency (FSA) to identify a county, equivalent entity, or combination thereof within the United States, its possessions, and associated areas as defined within Handbook 1-CM, Exhibit 100.

Many of the code values used by are similar to County ANSI/FIPS Code, which follows the American National Standards Institute (ANSI) numeric INCITS 31-2009 and Federal Information Processing Standards Publications (FIPS Pub) 6-4 standard. The expanded even-numbered FSA codes identify counties that contain more than one office due to geographic considerations.

Specific values are documented in Handbook 1-CM. A machine-readable version can be found here

data_elements.name: Farm Number

business_rules.description: Must be an active farm in the pilot area
Must use active combinations of Administrative State FSA Code, Administrative County FSA Code, Farm Number, Tract Number, Field Number, and CLU Identifier per FSA Farm Records

data_elements.definition:
An identification number assigned to all land under control of a particular operator within a particular county.

Each County assigns Farm Numbers independently. As a result, farms in different counties might be assigned the same Farm Number; i.e, a Farm Number might be unique only within a particular county. Thus, to uniquely identify a farm, the State FSA Code and County FSA Code must be specified in combination with the Farm Number.

data_elements.name: Tract Number

business_rules.description: Must be among the list of tracts associated with Farms as found in CLU the layer
Must use active combinations of Administrative State FSA Code, Administrative County FSA Code, Farm Number, Tract Number, Field Number, and CLU Identifier per FSA Farm Records

data_elements.definition:
An identification number assigned to a unit of contiguous land that is under one ownership and that is operated as a farm or part of a farm. An owner is a person or business having deed to the land.

Tract numbers are assigned by an FSA county office, and are unique within that office''s farms. A Tract Number is used in conjunction with a State FSA Code and County FSA Code for uniqueness.

Tract numbers are not necessarily unique based upon State ANSI Code and County ANSI in instance where the ANSI codes are not the same as the FSA codes.

data_elements.name: Field Number

business_rules.description: Must be among the list of fields associated with a Tract and for the Farm as found in the CLU layer
Must use active combinations of Administrative State FSA Code, Administrative County FSA Code, Farm Number, Tract Number, Field Number, and CLU Identifier per FSA Farm Records

data_elements.definition:
An identification number assigned to a field of land that is part of a farm tract.

Field numbers are assigned by an FSA county office, and are unique within that office''s farms. A Field Number is used in conjunction with Tract Number, State FSA Code and County FSA Code for uniqueness.

Field number and Tract Number are not necessarily unique based upon State ANSI Code and County ANSI Code in instances where the ANSI codes are not the same as the FSA codes.

data_elements.name: Common Land Unit Identifier

business_rules.description: Must be associated with the Field associated with the tract and for the Farm as found in the CLU layer
Must use active combinations of Administrative State FSA Code, Administrative County FSA Code, Farm Number, Tract Number, Field Number, and CLU Identifier per FSA Farm Records
Must in format XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXX

data_elements.definition:
A system-generated internal identifier of a common land unit (CLU). This identifier is for internal access use only.

A CLU is the smallest unit of land that has a permanent, contiguous boundary, common land cover and land management, a common owner, and a common producer association.

A CLU is closely related to FSA''s definition of 'fields', according to Handbook 2-CP. A CLU is also closely related to land units such as parcels, farmsteads, and lots that are used by NRCS, RMA and RD.

The authoritative source of CLU Identifier is Farm Records. CLU Identifier can remain constant even if the precise geospatial shape of the CLU is slightly altered.

data_elements.name: Agriculture Production Plan
data_elements.definition: An agricultural production plan describes the details of a crop that is planted on a specific field or subfield of land.

data_elements.name: Common Land Unit Producer Review Request Indicator
data_elements.definition: True if the producer has requested that a Common Land Unit (CLU) be reviewed; false otherwise.

data_elements.name: State ANSI Code

business_rules.description: The value must be valid ANSI state

data_elements.definition: A code defined within the American National Standards Institute (ANSI) numeric INCITS 38-2009 standard for a state within the United States, a United States possession, freely associated area of the United States, or combination thereof.

data_elements.name: County ANSI Code

business_rules.description: The value must be valid ANSI county for the applicable value in State ANSI Code

data_elements.definition: A code defined within the American National Standards Institute (ANSI) numeric INCITS 31-2009 standard to identify a county or equivalent entity within the United States, its possessions, and associated areas. A County ANSI Code is unique only when associated with the state or equivalent entity of the United States in which the county is physically located.

data_elements.name: Subfield Number

business_rules.description: Must be blank if an agricultural production plan covers an entire Field/CLU.
Must be populated if there is more than one agricultural plan (aka field is split into multiple subfields).
The only values allowed are from A through ZZ (ex:  A, B, C…AA,AB,….ZZ), assigned alphabetically (A, B, C…AA, AB…ZZ) with no duplication within the same Field.

data_elements.definition: An alpha 'number' that is used to uniquely identify a subfield within a field, within a tract within a farm within a state and county. Subfields are areas of a field that share a set of common planting characteristic in terms of crop, crop type, intended use, etc. By convention the first defined subfield is given a value of 'A', with subsequent subfields following in alphabetic order.

data_elements.name: Core Product Code

business_rules.description: USDA provided list of values from CVT to be used (reference document yet to be identified)
Must use allowable combinations of Core Product Code, Core Product Type Code, and Product Intended Use Code per the pilot CVT

data_elements.definition: A product code providing a classification of agricultural products defined by the Pilot CVT (Crop Validation Table). Products are classified into individual crop and commodity types, tree types, and types of livestock.

data_elements.name: Core Product Type Code

business_rules.description: USDA provided list of values from CVT to be used (reference document yet to be identified)
Must use allowable combinations of Core Product Code, Core Product Type Code, and Product Intended Use Code per the pilot CVT

data_elements.definition: A product type code providing a subclassification of agricultural products in addition to the main classification provided by the Core Product Code. Each product classified by a Core Product Code is also assigned a Core Product Type Code providing greater clarification of the crop/commodity, tree, livestock ,etc. Codes are maintained by the Pilot CVT (Crop Validation Table).

data_elements.name: Product Intended Use Code

business_rules.description: USDA provided list of values from CVT to be used (reference document yet to be identified)
Must use allowable combinations of Core Product Code, Core Product Type Code, and Product Intended Use Code per the pilot CVT

data_elements.definition: A product code identifying the intended use for an agricultural product such as a crop/commodity, tree, livestock, etc. Codes for intended uses are specific to a particular combination of Core Product Code and Core Product Type Code and are maintained by the Pilot CVT (Crop Validation Table).

data_elements.name: Original Reported Acreage

business_rules.description: Cannot be a negative value
Must equal Final Reported Acreage when Reported Acreage Modified Indicator = N
Cannot equal Final Reported Acreage when Reported Acreage Modified Indicator = Y

data_elements.definition: The original, unmodified, number of acres that were reported.

data_elements.name: Final Reported Acreage

business_rules.description: Cannot be a negative value
Must equal Original Reported Acreage when Reported Acreage Modified Indicator = N
Cannot equal Original Reported Acreage when Reported Acreage Modified Indicator = Y

data_elements.definition: The final number of acres that were reported.

data_elements.name: Reported Acreage Modified Indicator

business_rules.description: If no geospatial data is attached only allowed value is N

data_elements.definition: True if the reported acreage was modified from its original value; false otherwise.

data_elements.name: Reported Acreage Modified Reason Code

business_rules.description: Cannot be populated when Reported Acreage Modified Indicator = N
Must be populated when Reported Acreage Modified Indicator = Y

data_elements.definition: A reason code identifying the reason that the reported acreage was modified from its original value.

data_elements.name: Reported Acreage Modified Other Reason Text
data_elements.data_element_example: This change X is the reason why the acreage was modified

business_rules.description: Cannot be populated when Geospatial Share Modified Reason Code <> O
Must be populated when Geospatial Share Modified Reason Code = O

data_elements.definition: An other reason code identifying the reason that the reported acreage was modified from its original value.

data_elements.name: Acreage Calculation Projection Code

business_rules.description: Only populated when geospatial data is submitted

data_elements.definition: A calculation code identifying the geospatial projection standard used for calculating acreage.

data_elements.name: Original Planted Date
data_elements.definition: The original value for the date that a specific crop was planted.

business_rules.description: Must be less than the current date (today).

data_elements.name: Final Planted Date

business_rules.description: Must be less than the current date (today).

data_elements.definition: The final value for the date that a specific crop was planted.

data_elements.name: Planted Date Modified Indicator
data_elements.definition: True if the planted date was modified from its original value; false otherwise.

data_elements.name: Planted Date Modified Reason Code
data_elements.definition: A code identifying the reason that a planted date was modified from its original value.

data_elements.name: Planted Date Modified Other Reason Text
data_elements.data_element_example: The reason for changing the plant data is because of XYZ.
data_elements.definition: A free form text providing the reason that a planted date was modified from its original value when a reason other than the possible list of provided reasons is needed.

data_elements.name: Product Planting Code
data_elements.definition: A code identifying the planting of a product/crop as either conventional (plannted as normal or no planting required) or unconventional/irregular in a predefined way.

enumeration.value_definition: Failed Acreage (acreage that was timely planted with the intent to harvest, but because of disaster related conditions, the crop failed before it could be brought to harvest).
Prevented Planted (the inability to plant the intended crop acreage with proper equipment by the final planting date for the crop type because of a natural disaster).

Volunteer. A crop that was planted in a previous crop year on the applicable acreage or drifted from other acreage, successfully self-seeded, and is growing this crop year on the applicable acreage without being intentionally sown or managed.

data_elements.name: Irrigation Practice Code
data_elements.definition: A code identifying the irrigation practice used for a unit of land with a cropCode identifying the irrigation practice used for a unit of land with a crop.

data_elements.name: Organic Practice Type Code
data_elements.definition: A code representing the type of certification for farm acreage in regards to a system/plan of production and handling practice to produce an organic commodity.

data_elements.name: Cropping Practice Code
data_elements.definition: A code identifying the cropping practice applicable for a reported crop/commodity on a field/subfield.

data_elements.name: Producer Share
data_elements.definition: A share in the benefits that a producer has from a specific agricultural production plan.

data_elements.name: Producer Share Percent
data_elements.definition: A Producer's share of a crop and the benefits coming from that crop, expressed as a percentage.

data_elements.name: Geospatial Source Information
data_elements.definition: A set of source information about geospatial details related to an agricultural production plan.

data_elements.name: Geospatial Shape Source Code
data_elements.definition: A code identifying the source data used to create a geospatial shape/polygon.

enumeration.value_definition: Field Boundaries:  Polygon is based on the outer boundaries of the field (i.e., vehicle GPS capabilities)
CLU:  Existing FSA CLU was used to provide the shape/polygon
FMIS:  Shape/polygon has been created by the producer’s Farm Management Information System
Raw Controller File:  Shape/polygon has been created from a producer submitted raw controller file
Digitized:  Third party provider/producer has drawn/digitized the shape/polygon

data_elements.name: Geospatial Shape Modified Indicator
data_elements.definition: True if the geospatial shape/polygon was modified from its original value; false otherwise.

data_elements.name: Geospatial Shape Modified Reason Code
data_elements.definition: A code identifying the reason that a geospatial shape/polygon was modified from its original shape.

data_elements.name: Geospatial Shape Modified Other Reason Text
data_elements.data_element_example: The reason for the change in geospatial is XYZ.
data_elements.definition: A free form text providing the reason that a geospatial shape was modified from its original form when a reason other than the possible list of provided reasons is needed.

data_elements.name: Geospatial Shape Process Date
data_elements.definition: A date that a geospatial shape/polygon was created, either from processing raw data or from manual entry.

data_elements.name: Geospatial Data Submission Method Code
data_elements.definition: A code identifying the method used to submit geospatial data used to create a geospatial shape/polygon.

enumeration.value_definition: CLU - Existing FSA CLU is used to provide the shape/polygon
GIS Algorithm – GIS algorithm used by third party provider/producer system to create operational boundaries based on raw data collection method (MICS, FMIS)
Digitized - Third party provider/producer has drawn/digitized the shape/polygon

data_elements.name: Mobile Implement Control System Code
data_elements.definition: A code identifying the Mobile Implement Control System (MICS) used in the collection of geospatial data.

data_elements.name: Mobile Implement Control System Name
data_elements.definition: A code name identifying the Mobile Implement Control System (MICS) used in the collection of geospatial data.

data_elements.name: Geospatial Source Data Creation Date
data_elements.definition: A date when the data that was used as a source for geospatial data being considered. For geospatial data sourced by means of Precision Agriculture, this is the date the raw data was collected by the equipment. For geospatial data that was created from an existing Common Land Unit (CLU) shape, this is the date the source CLU was created.

data_elements.name: Precision Agricultural Sub-meter Accuracy Indicator
data_elements.definition: True if geospatial data collected from Precision Agriculture technology has horizontal coordinate measurements that are accurate within a sub meter; false otherwise.

data_elements.name: Location Polygon Coordinates
data_elements.definition: A gml:Polygon is a special surface that is defined by a single surface patch. The boundary of this patch is coplanar and the polygon uses planar interpolation in its interior.

data_elements.name: Location Multi-Surface Coordinates
data_elements.definition: A geometry collection that includes one or more Polygons or Surfaces.

data_elements.name: Originator Identification

business_rules.description: The first letter of 'originatorIdentification' must be any of these values 'A','F','T'

Value for the channels:  AIP -> 'A'+ 2 digit RMA code,  County office-> 'F'+ State Code+County Code, Third Party-> 'T'+ assign site id Note: validation against list of RMA codes, FSA ST/Co, Thirdparty - TMYA]

data_elements.data_element_example:
Examples of an Originator are a FSA Service Center, Approved Insurance Provider (AIP), and Third Party Sites. The identification consists of a prefix indicating the type of Originator, followed by an identification that uniquely identifies the Originator for that type.
For FSA Service Center Originators, the following format is used:
F
For AIP Originators, the following format is used:
A
For Third Party Site Originators, the following format is used:
T
data_elements.definition:
An identification of the entity responsible for originating/publishing data.

For Acreage Reporting it identifies the FSA Service Center, Approved Insurance Provider (AIP), or Third Party Site which collected and published the acreage data and any accompanying geospatial data.

The identification consists of a prefix indicating the type of Originator, followed by an identification that uniquely identifies the Originator for that type.

data_elements.name: Customer Information
data_elements.definition: An individual, corporation, partnership, association, tribe, unit of government, Conservation District, or other organization with which a USDA Service Center has had, or may have, business.

data_elements.name: File Customer Identifier

business_rules.description: fileCustomerIdentifier' must be >0  and uniquely (no duplication) refers to the customer in the customer Entity inside the JSON file

data_elements.definition: An internal identifier uniquely identifying a customer within a specific file. Each unique customer within a given file will have a unique File Customer Identifier. File Customer Identifier values are not unique across files.

data_elements.name: Customer Inter-Agency Identifier

business_rules.description: Populated with active CCID associated with a TIN and TIN Type

data_elements.definition:
A system generated, unique internal identifier used between agencies to identify a USDA customer (individual or business).

Currently SCIMS Core Customer Identifier is the source value. This will change if a different customer unique identifier is adopted.

data_elements.name: Tax Identification

business_rules.description: It must be populated if Interagency Customer Identifier is null
It must be null if Interagency Customer Identifier is populated

data_elements.definition:
A tax identification assigned to a specific individual, business or other entity and is used to authenticate the individual/entity for matters of taxation and other federal governement business.
Tax Identification may be a Social Security or Employer Identification number.

Federal Tax Identification is not necessarily unique for all United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) customers unless it is combined with a Tax Identification Type Code.

data_elements.name: Tax Identification Type Code

business_rules.description: It must be populated if Interagency Customer Identifier is null
It must be null if Interagency Customer Identifier is populated

data_elements.definition: A type code identifying the type of identification assigned to a specific individual, business or other entity and is used to authenticate the individual/entity for matters of taxation and other governement business.

data_elements.name: Business Name
data_elements.definition: The name of a non-individual which transacts business with a USDA office. This can be a business, group, partnership, family-owned farm or ranch, etc. to which the servicing office provides assistance.  In the case of a family farm or ranch operation, the business name can be the same as the individual's name.

data_elements.name: First Name
data_elements.definition: The first name in the full (multi-part) name of an individual (person) or entity.

data_elements.name: Middle Name
data_elements.definition: The middle (or second, or alternate) name in the full (multi-part) name of an individual or entity.

data_elements.name: Last Name
data_elements.definition: Last name in the full name (multi-part) of an individual (person) or entity.

data_elements.name: Name Suffix
data_elements.definition:
A free-form optional suffix used in an individual's name. The following list comprises the suggested domain. However, the user should be able to type in entries not found in this list.
DOMAIN: Jr, Sr, I, II, III, MD

data_elements.name: Acreage Submission File

business_rules.description: This element contains Crop Year, Originator Identification Identifier, Customer Information and Farm Crop Acreage.

data_elements.definition: A file that is submitted to the crop acreage clearinghouse providing a detailed report regarding the crops planted on a farm, itemized down to the acreage of individual fields and subfields and the individual producer stakeholders.

data_elements.name: Field Crop Acreage
data_elements.definition: A field of land within a tract on which groupings of crops can be planted.

data_elements.name: Farm Crop Acreage
data_elements.definition: A Farm within Farm Service Agency (FSA) state and county that contains a number of tracts fields and subfields on which crop acreage details have been reported.

data_elements.name: Tract Crop Acreage
data_elements.definition: A tract of land within a farm that contains a number of fields and subfields on which crop acreage details have been reported.
